definition:
Let $R$ be a ring, and let $M$ be an $R$-module. A prime ideal $P$ of
$R$ is an for $M$ if $P={\rm ann}(X)$, the annihilator of some nonzero
submodule $X$ of $M$.

Note that if this is the case, then the module ${\rm ann}_M(P)$ contains
$X$, has $P$ as its annihilator, and is a $(R/P)$-module.

If, in addition, $P$ is equal to the annihilator of a submodule of $M$
that is a $(R/P)$-module, then we call $P$ an of $M$.
